CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {6} slices in this chart.

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Angel Investments relative to the peak of Bonds in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Angel Investments is to the {left} of the peak of Bonds.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Commodities show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Commodities shows a {Single Peak Distribution}.

VPR.Q: At what value do  Angel Investments reach its peaks?

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Commodities} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =-1.6?
EVJ.A: At X =-1.6,the label with the highest density is {Stock Market}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 5? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Peer-to-Peer Lending}'s peak at {23},{Real Estate}'s peak at {17},{Bonds}'s peak at {24}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 8? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Stock Market}'s peak at {-5},{Commodities}'s peak at {-6},{Angel Investments}'s peak at {-4}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Angel Investments or Commodities?
NC.A: {Angel Investments} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Stock Market or Angel Investments?
NC.A: {Angel Investments} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {3} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Commodities}
